speaker: Boy
text_entry: SCENE V. Another part of the field.

speaker: Boy
text_entry: Enter Constable, ORLEANS, BOURBON, DAUPHIN, and RAMBURES

speaker: Constable
text_entry: O diable!

speaker: ORLEANS
text_entry: O seigneur! le jour est perdu, tout est perdu!

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Mort de ma vie! all is confounded, all!

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Reproach and everlasting shame

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Sits mocking in our plumes. O merchante fortune!

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Do not run away.

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: A short alarum

speaker: Constable
text_entry: Why, all our ranks are broke.

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: O perdurable shame! let's stab ourselves.

speaker: DAUPHIN
text_entry: Be these the wretches that we play'd at dice for?

speaker: ORLEANS
text_entry: Is this the king we sent to for his ransom?

speaker: BOURBON
text_entry: Shame and eternal shame, nothing but shame!

speaker: BOURBON
text_entry: Let us die in honour: once more back again;

speaker: BOURBON
text_entry: And he that will not follow Bourbon now,

speaker: BOURBON
text_entry: Let him go hence, and with his cap in hand,

speaker: BOURBON
text_entry: Like a base pander, hold the chamber-door

speaker: BOURBON
text_entry: Whilst by a slave, no gentler than my dog,

speaker: BOURBON
text_entry: His fairest daughter is contaminated.

speaker: Constable
text_entry: Disorder, that hath spoil'd us, friend us now!

speaker: Constable
text_entry: Let us on heaps go offer up our lives.

speaker: ORLEANS
text_entry: We are enow yet living in the field

speaker: ORLEANS
text_entry: To smother up the English in our throngs,

speaker: ORLEANS
text_entry: If any order might be thought upon.

speaker: BOURBON
text_entry: The devil take order now! I'll to the throng:

speaker: BOURBON
text_entry: Let life be short; else shame will be too long.

speaker: BOURBON
text_entry: Exeunt
